sensehubr 0.1.0
  • Reference

Penalty analysis of sensory data

Source: R/analyse-penalty.R
analyse_penalty.Rd

Perform penalty analysis on sensory table.

analyse_penalty(data, reference_value)

Arguments

data

a sensory table
reference_value

a score used as JAR value (reference)

Examples

perfume_jar %>%
  specify(
    sensory_method = "JAR",
    panelist = consumer,
    product = product,
    attribute = intensity:green,
    hedonic = liking
  ) %>%
  analyse_penalty(reference_value = 0)
#> # Penalty analysis: 
#> # Sensory method:    Just-about-Right
#> # Analytical method: T-test
#>    product attribute category   frequency penalty std.error statistic   p.value
#>    <chr>   <chr>     <chr>          <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 Angel   intensity Too high        62.1  2.12       0.462   -4.58   0.0000133
#>  2 Angel   intensity Not enough      11.7  0.0185     0.699   -0.0265 0.979    
#>  3 Angel   freshness Too high        10.7  1.91       0.746   -2.56   0.0120   
#>  4 Angel   freshness Not enough      63.1  2          0.477   -4.19   0.0000605
#>  5 Angel   jasmin    Too high        20.4  1.36       0.576   -2.36   0.0200   
#>  6 Angel   jasmin    Not enough      42.7  1.73       0.469   -3.70   0.000358 
#>  7 Angel   rose      Too high        10.7  2.59       0.691   -3.75   0.000298 
#>  8 Angel   rose      Not enough      46.6  1.67       0.428   -3.91   0.000167 
#>  9 Angel   camomille Too high        21.4  1.00       0.575   -1.74   0.0845   
#> 10 Angel   camomille Not enough      33.0  0.634      0.502   -1.26   0.209    
#> # … with 494 more rows
